alert.note: Alert for Southern Dona Ana County, Mesilla Valley; Southern Tularosa Basin (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 3:48PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Dona Ana County through 415 PM MDT... At 348 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Mesquite to near Berino. Movement was southwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Vado, Anthony, Berino, Chamberino, San Miguel, Mesquite, La Mesa, Talavera and High Valley. This includes Interstate 10 in New Mexico between mile markers 150 and 162. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Southern Dona Ana County, Mesilla Valley; Southern Tularosa Basin
